jchrest.architecture

Class Perceiver

  • java.lang.Object
    • jchrest.architecture.Perceiver

  • public class Perceiver
extends java.lang.Object
    Manages storage of Fixations and some domain-agnostic functionality of Fixation performance. Fixations are stored in chronological order of performance.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void clearFixations(int time)
      Clears all Fixations in the relevant data structure at the time specified and resets the counter that tracks what Fixations have been learned from in the data structure to 0.
      int getFixationFieldOfView() 
      java.util.List<Fixation> getFixations(int time) 
      java.util.List<Fixation> getFixationsPerformed(int time) 
      Fixation getMostRecentFixationPerformed(int time) 
      ListPattern getObjectsSeenInFixationFieldOfView(Fixation fixation, boolean normaliseListPattern) 
      void setFixationFieldOfView(int fov)
      The value of this parameter is set, by default, to 2 according to section 8.7.6 of "Perception and Memory in Chess" by deGroot and Gobet (see the discussion of the "Peripheral-Square" heuristic).

      • Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

        clone, equals, finalize, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

    • Method Detail

      • getObjectsSeenInFixationFieldOfView

        public ListPattern getObjectsSeenInFixationFieldOfView(Fixation fixation,
                                                       boolean normaliseListPattern)
        Parameters:
        fixation -
        normaliseListPattern - Set to Boolean.TRUE if the ListPattern is to be sent as input to DomainSpecifics.normalise(jchrest.lib.ListPattern) before being returned. Set to Boolean.FALSE to return the ListPattern as-is, i.e. with all SceneObjects fixated on present.
        Returns:

      • clearFixations

        public void clearFixations(int time)
        Clears all Fixations in the relevant data structure at the time specified and resets the counter that tracks what Fixations have been learned from in the data structure to 0.
        Parameters:
        time -

      • getFixations

        public java.util.List<Fixation> getFixations(int time)
        Parameters:
        time -
        Returns:
        The most recent Fixations at the time specified or null if #this did not exist at the time specified. Note that the most recent Fixation added will be at the end of the List whereas the oldest will be at the front.

      • getFixationsPerformed

        public java.util.List<Fixation> getFixationsPerformed(int time)
        Parameters:
        time -
        Returns:
        All Fixations that have been performed at the time specified or null if no Fixations have been added before/at the time specified.

      • getMostRecentFixationPerformed

        public Fixation getMostRecentFixationPerformed(int time)
        Parameters:
        time -
        Returns:
        The most recent Fixation performed according to the time specified or null if there are no Fixations at the time specified or no Fixations stored have been performed successfully.

      • getFixationFieldOfView

        public int getFixationFieldOfView()
        Returns:
        The number of Squares in each compass direction that can be seen when a Fixation is added using #this#addFixation(jchrest.domainSpecifics.Fixation). The value of this parameter is set, by default, to 2 according to section 8.7.6 of "Perception and Memory in Chess" by deGroot and Gobet (see the discussion of the "Peripheral-Square" heuristic).

      • setFixationFieldOfView

        public void setFixationFieldOfView(int fov)
        The value of this parameter is set, by default, to 2 according to section 8.7.6 of "Perception and Memory in Chess" by deGroot and Gobet (see the discussion of the "Peripheral-Square" heuristic).
        Parameters:
        fov - The number of Squares in each compass direction that can be seen when a Fixation is added using #this#addFixation(jchrest.domainSpecifics.Fixation).
